title: How to Change Colours in Windows Command Prompt

steps.title: Press windows + R to open run.
steps.content: Press windows + R to open run.

steps.title: Type 'cmd' (without the quotes) and click ok.
steps.content: Type 'cmd' (without the quotes) and click ok.

steps.title: Type color z to get the list of all colors and numbers or letters assigned for them.
steps.content: Type color z to get the list of all colors and numbers or letters assigned for them. The first letter/number in the command is the colour of the background and the second is the colour of the text.

steps.title: Type color letter/number to change the text color.
steps.content: Type color letter/number to change the text color. Use the letter/number for the color you want. e.g. Type 'color 6' to have yellow text, 'color 4' to have red text, 'color A' to have light green text etc. ( Ignore all quotes )

steps.title: To change the colour of the text as well as the background, type 'color ce' ( without the quotes ) to have light yellow text on a light red background or any other combination.
steps.content: To change the colour of the text as well as the background, type 'color ce' ( without the quotes ) to have light yellow text on a light red background or any other combination.

steps.title: Select text or background and edit the color values.
steps.content: Select text or background and edit the color values. Play around with the combinations!
